StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_ImportMUDData]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@OrgID int, @UserLogin varchar(30)
AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @DBID INT, @DBNAME NVARCHAR(128), @HR VARCHAR(150)
SET @DBID = DB_ID() SET @DBNAME = DB_NAME() SET @HR = 0
Insert into MUD_Staging( [CITY] ,[STATE] ,[ZIP] ,[AREA_CODE] ,[FIPS] ,[COUNTY] ,[TIMEZONE] ,[DST] ,[LATITUDE] ,[LONGITUDE] ,[TYPE]) SELECT [City] ,[ST] ,[ZIP] ,[A/C] ,[FIPS] ,[County] ,[T/Z] ,[DST?] ,[Lat] ,[Long] ,[Type] FROM [MCRISS].[dbo].[Sheet1$]
exec sp_GetMUDNewFIPS IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred adding new FIPS.' END
exec sp_GetMUDDeletedZips IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred dele.ng ZipCodes.' ---RETURN END
exec sp_MUDImportNewZips IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred adding zipcodes.' ---RETURN END
exec sp_GetMUDReAc.vateZips IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred reac.va.ng zipcodes.' ---RETURN END
exec sp_UpdateMUDCordData IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred upda.ng MUD coordinates.' ---RETURN END
exec sp_GetNewMUDStateCityCnty IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred adding new State/County data.' ---RETURN END
TRUNCATE TABLE MUD_STAGING
TRUNCATE TABLE MUD_NEW_ZIPCODES
IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @HR = 'An error occurred during the import of MUD data.' ---RETURN END
--- UPDATE MUD FILE UPLOAD LOG HERE IF THE DTS PACKAGE PROCESSED SUCCESSFULLY IF @OrgID IS NOT NULL AND @UserLogin IS NOT NULL AND @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN EXEC sp_UpdateMUDFileLog @OrgID, @UserLogin END
SELECT @HR AS ERROR_DESCRIPTION
SET NOCOUNT OFF
